oai_dc:dc.dc:contributor: The New Digital Bleek and Lloyd
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: |han=kass'o (Klein Jantje) (VIII)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Concerning certain Kafirs from the northern side of the Orange River. (L VIII.27. 8387-8390). The black people ('Kafirs') in |han=kass'o's country live to the north (or the 'other side') of the Orange River. He calls them 'Kaal Kafirs' and describes some of their customs and doings. 1) p.8387v: the black people eat locusts and use nets, 2) p.8388v: the name for the 'passage' between the upper front teeth (used by |han=kass'o's mother |xabbi-an), 3) This story is found in Book VIII-27.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lucy Lloyd |xam notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Others living north of the Orange River
